I had a small package delivered today via Fedex containing a SIM that I was going to use in my phone. 

But the package was opened, and there was nothing inside. 

This seems to be happening a lot these days. Hackers get jobs at Fedex or UPS and grab stuff as it's in transit.

subs.text:
@davegandy -- see the UI puzzle above. 

Here's what I really want. On the original Mac, they had a clock desk accessory that you could set alarms with. It had a flag, like the flag on a mailbox, that would toggle between up and down.
subs.rawText:
@davegandy -- see the UI puzzle above. 

Here's what I really want. On the original Mac, they had a clock desk accessory that you could set alarms with. It had a flag, like the flag on a mailbox, that would toggle between up and down.

subs.text: If down it would reveal the details, if up, the details were hidden. Below is a screen shot from Wikipedia with an arrow pointing to the icon. Today we could do better. This would be a welcome addition to Font-Awesome. [link]

subs.rawText: 1/3 If you're a #toolsforthought person, you must've seen me beating the drum for interop between outliners. My preferred format is OPML, but if real interop is built with another format, I'll support it in Drummer.

subs.text: 2/3 I eased up on my evangelism for OPML because the various teams in #tft seem busy focused on their own products, and aren't thinking a lot about interop these days, I guess. So I got to work on another project, but I'll be coming back to this. I do not give up easily. :-)
subs.rawText: 2/3 I eased up on my evangelism for OPML because the various teams in #tft seem busy focused on their own products, and aren't thinking a lot about interop these days, I guess. So I got to work on another project, but I'll be coming back to this. I do not give up easily. :-)

subs.text:
Another related thought.

Did you know Twitter is a feed reader?

It is except it's private, doesn't use RSS.

You could build a feed reader, based on RSS that had Twitter's user experience. It can be done. 

But why haven't RSS-based feed readers evolved to work like Twitter?

@TaylorLorenz Taylor, I was for a while the center of the blogging world, and all the abuse we were gathering was aimed at me. 

People would figure out who I was dating, and then go after them. Same for the people who worked with me.
subs.rawText:
@TaylorLorenz Taylor, I was for a while the center of the blogging world, and all the abuse we were gathering was aimed at me. 

People would figure out who I was dating, and then go after them. Same for the people who worked with me.

subs.text:
@TaylorLorenz Eventually I deliberately cut down on my fame. To take the focus off me. A lifestyle choice. 

I don't know that there's any other way out of the problem. Writing about it publicly only makes it worse I found. Very little sympathy out there for the person at or near the top.
subs.rawText:
@TaylorLorenz Eventually I deliberately cut down on my fame. To take the focus off me. A lifestyle choice.
